channel.title: The Electric Pineapple PopUp
channel.description: Recent content on The Electric Pineapple PopUp

item.title: Name of the work 2
item.description: When she reached the first hills of the Italic Mountains, she had a last view back on the skyline of her hometown Bookmarksgrove, the headline of Alphabet Village and the subline of her own road, the Line Lane.

item.title: Name of the work 3
item.description: Fifth abundantly made Give sixth hath. Cattle creature i be don’t them.

item.title: Menu
item.description:
Header Level 2

Far far away, behind the word mountains, far from the countries Vokalia and Consonantia, there live the blind texts. A small river named Duden flows by their place and supplies it with the necessary regelialia. It is a paradisematic country, in which roasted parts of sentences fly into your mouth.

item.title: Name of the work 1
item.description: Even the all-powerful Pointing has no control about the blind texts it is an almost unorthographic life. One day however a small line of blind text by the name of Lorem Ipsum decided to leave for the far World of Grammar.

item.title: Hello R Markdown
item.description: R Markdown This is an R Markdown document. Markdown is a simple formatting syntax for authoring HTML, PDF, and MS Word documents. For more details on using R Markdown see http://rmarkdown.rstudio.com. You can embed an R code chunk like this: summary(cars) ## speed dist ## Min. : 4.0 Min. : 2.00 ## 1st Qu.:12.0 1st Qu.: 26.00 ## Median :15.0 Median : 36.00 ## Mean :15.4 Mean : 42.98 ## 3rd Qu.

item.title: How the pineapple connects the South to the North in Hawaii
item.description: Pineapple Casserole at a Southern Funeral Pacific Imperialism Characteristics, Ecology, History Bromeliad Native to South America Scientific name is derived from a native word for tasty fruit Transported by natives to the Carribean Encountered by Cristopher Columbus Hospitality: Rareity and association with returning seamen Sugar and Other Foods for Colonization New England missionaries and entrepreneurs Hospitality foods to re-inforce invasion James Hunnewell Peter Cushman Jones Sanford Dole Colonial Foods become Imperial Foods Hawaiian League Teddy Roosevelt Henry Cabot Lodge The Quest for Annexation Bayonet Treaty New Lands Resolution Hawaiian Organic Act Annexation Statehood Imperial Foods become Industrial Foods James D Dole C&H The Big Five Hawaii Companies Matson Shipping US “Apologies” and the Rights of the Disenfranchised 1988 Civil Liberties Act - Japanese Internment (Reagan) 1993 Hawaiian Apology Resolution (Clinton) 1997 Tuskegee Experiment (Clinton) 2008 Slavery Jim Crow Laws Apology Resolution (Obama) Apologies explicitely written to not have legal impact David Akaka (Senator Hawaii, Deceased Apr 6 2018) James H Blount: An Unlikely Ally of Blount Report “Freedom does not necessarily mean freedom from alien domination, bot unly a change of masters deemed by the new master beneficial to the ‘slave’.

item.title: How the pineapple connects the South to the North in Hawaii
item.description: Pineapple Casserole at a Southern Funeral Pacific Imperialism Characteristics, Ecology, History Bromeliad Native to South America Scientific name is derived from a native word for tasty fruit Transported by natives to the Carribean Encountered by Cristopher Columbus Hospitality: Rareity and association with returning seamen Sugar and Other Foods for Colonization New England missionaries and entrepreneurs Hospitality foods to re-inforce invasion James Hunnewell Peter Cushman Jones Sanford Dole Colonial Foods become Imperial Foods Hawaiian League Teddy Roosevelt Henry Cabot Lodge Imperial Foods become Industrial Foods James D Dole C&H The Big Five Hawaii Companies Matson Shipping Modern Movement for First People’s Rights Bearsears National Monument Other Foods Common between the South and Hawaii Pig roast Sweet potato Greens (Taro, Poke, Collards, Mustards) Southern Sugar and Pineapple Production American Sugar Refining Connection to African Slave Trade?

item.title: Poke Sallet
item.description: “… probably the best known and most widely used wild vegetable in America.” Euell Gibbons (needs verification) Characteristics, Ecology, History Phytolacca americana Phytolaccin Native to North America (also possibly found in Africa) Appalachian staple Associated with poor, rural south (e.g. “Poke Salad Annie”) Exported to Europe as an ornamental Used by the Algonquin for dye Civil War Era Letters possibly written in Pokeberry ink Pigeon Berry Eaten in large quantities by passenger pigeons
